intro: Brachycorythis henryi, commonly known as the Henry's short-stemmed orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically features linear leaves and produces small, showy blooms in shades of white and pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Brachycorythis henryi is considered a valuable but endangered species in its native range.
